date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: Last bought my 9.5 year old son Crocs nearly 3 years ago.  He wears sneakers to school and otherwise Crocs.  I was surprised when he told me how long the Crocs had lasted before he wore through the bottom of them.  Nothing lasts that long with kids.  His old shoes were a size 2 and we wanted a size 3 now.  I was confused by the sizing because "Big Kids" starts at a 4 and I assume that he is a "Big Kid".  The sizes in order of the pull-down menu are: "Little Kid 1, 2, 3, 6, 10, 11,12, Big Kid 4, 5, 6".  But that is not the correct size order.  I think the correct size order should be: "Little Kid 6, 10, 11, 12, 1, 2, 3, Big Kid 4, 5, 6".  So, a "Little Kid" 3 is larger than a "Little Kid" 12.  After thinking they didn't have his size, I finally figured this out and bought the "Little Kid" 3.  The shoes fit and are even a bit large.  We are happy, but hope to help others who might be confused.  What is called "Little Kid" 1, 2, and 3 are really "Big Kid" sizes - that is, they are larger than "Little Kid" 12.
